content: This indicates a security error for your account, and can only be fixed by your email provider. Be sure to notify them of this, as the problem will not go away. Google has been tightening security recently and we see posts such as yours regularly.
creator: davidsk

content:
Hola, Los archivos de los correos tienen el formato estándar de texto mbox por lo tanto son formatos para abrirse con clientes de correo como Thunderbird, Eudora, etc, puedes abrirlos con un editor de texto pero sera complicado (engorroso) separar las partes de cada correo: cabeceras, direcciones, mensajes, etc. Mi conclusión es: sirve para buscar un "texto determinado" de un correo: Si, sirve para recuperar todos los correos en un formato siempre de visualizar: No.

Si se ha resuelto la consulta agradeceríamos marcar como solucionada para que sirva a otros usuarios. ¡Gracias!
creator: pcp04

content:
The process of manually transferring files with an external hard drive is simple: Connect your device to one PC. Find the device in your file explorer, then drag the files you want to transfer onto the folder in the hard drive. Safely eject the hard drive, then connect it to the new PC.

Regards, Will

content:
Hi Ralph, if you do not see AppData here:

C:\Users\<username>\

Then Windows is still set to hide hidden files and folders. Check this article to set Windows to show those so you can go where you need to go:

https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/view-hidden-files-and-folders-in-windows-97fbc472-c603-9d90-91d0-1166d1d9f4b5

After that, you should see it. If not, paste this into the Windows File Explorer address bar and press Enter to jump directly into the folder:

%APPDATA%
creator: jscher2000

content:
David, thank you for your attempt to help me with this vexing problem. Your workaround is basically a slightly different way to move the Thunderbird data. Unfortunately, it did not work and I have been thoroughly surprised.

I copied the Thunderbird folder from the source (my old computer) on a thumb drive and it appeared that there were lots of files within the folder, so I assume it did a proper job of copying the contents of the folder. I then brought it to the new computer, went on Windows Explorer, and attempted to find the appropriate location for the folder. I went to C:\users\<myid>\ and that is where I saw the problem. There is no folder by the name of AppData.

This morning, when I was trying to transfer the data, some kind of app or program by the name of duet display appeared on my computer. I then did a little bit of research and it seems as though some other people have complained about this program appearing mysteriously on their computers. Based upon what I've read, which I do not thoroughly understand, I decided to uninstall that program. I don't know if this has anything to do with the disappearance of the AppData folder, but it is as good an explanation as any, especially since I can still find a file with the name duet display on it.

If I uninstall Thunderbird and then reinstall it, will the AppData folder be re-created along with the roaming and thunderbird files under it? Otherwise, I may be stuck restoring the computer to its default settings and I am certain that having to reinstall programs will probably cause more problems. Any ideas?

Again, I thank you for your attempt to help me.

Ralph
creator: rhill304

content: Try this: - on old computer, exit thunderbird and, in file explorer, copy c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird to a USB stick - on new computer, exit thunderbird and, in file explorer, copy the contents of above copy to the same location. You will be prompted for overwrite, but that's normal. Then start thunderbird.
creator: davidsk

content:
Spectrum provide the means for 3rd party apps via their own imap, pop and smtp server settings, but do not really have any knowledge on how anything works nor do they really care, after all they want you to use their webmail. They are not unique, it's a common issue.

Usually port 465 uses Connection SEcurity: SSL/TLS and port 587 uses Connection Security: STARTTLS

Try port 587 Connection Security: STARTTLS

Exit Thunderbird allow a few moments for background processes to complate and start Thunderbird.

content:
Two little suggestions:

Never put anything in Trash (alone) that you want to (even maybe) keep. Make copies and store them in Local Folders sub-folders.

Frequently empty the main Trash folder (the one above Local Folders). When your Trash folder is overflowing with recently deleted messages, the server might block deletions until you make some room in there.
creator: danawilson001

content:
To delete an email from the inbox in Firefox, you can follow these steps:

Open Firefox and log in to your email account. Go to the inbox folder where the email you want to delete is located. Locate the email you wish to delete. Hover your mouse cursor over the email to reveal the available actions. Look for the delete/trash icon, which is typically represented by a trash bin or a crossed-out garbage can. Click on the delete/trash icon to delete the email. Depending on your email client or provider, you may be prompted to confirm the deletion. If prompted, confirm that you want to delete the email. The email should now be moved to the trash or deleted items folder, depending on your email setup.

Hope this helps.

content:
On the Thunderbird menu bar, select Help > Troubleshooting Information. Next to Profile Folder, choose Show in Finder. Confirm that the existing profile folder and the profile backup have identical names. Quit Thunderbird. Replace the existing profile folder with the backup file.

Regards, Will

content:
You say you removed the accounts from thunderbird and are attempting to create the mail accounts again. First, please check to see that the old account and passwords have been completely removed from the saved passwords. This means we can rule out the problem being caused by any old saved data.

  • Settings > Privacy & Security
  • In Passwords section
  • click on 'Saved Passwords'
  • click on 'Show Passwords'

Do you see any lines - imap/mailbox/smtp/oauth that mention either of those google accounts? If yes, then please select them and click on 'Remove' Make sure there are no references to either of those accounts. click on 'Close'

Exit Thunderbird and wait a few moments for background processes to complete. Start Thunderbird. Try to add New > Existing Mail account

Report on Results.

content:
You may want to check your allowance of 3rd party apps in your Google Security. Recent changes in Google made me have to go back in and re-enable Thunderbird there.

Go to "myaccount.google.com" Click on the SECURITY Link. Look for "Your connections to third-party apps & services".

It should show "Mozilla Thunderbird Email"

If it doesn't, you need to add it.

content:
If the emails marked as SPAM are in a spam folder directly under your email, then that's a spam folder on the emails server and probably being marked there, on the email server, and not by Thunderbird.

So you may want to go to the source of the emails and check and see if they're already marked as spam there.

While there, you could WHITE LIST the specific email addresses you know are not spam, so the email server won't mark them as SPAM.

Each email account provider may have different ways of setting up a WHITE LIST, and you may also be able to adjust the sensitivity to the spam. For instance, some email hosts use spam filters like SpamAssassin where you can adjust setting. Thunderbird has a setting to Trust junk mail headers set by..." and you get to enable/disable it as well as select the type of headers it looks for.

You may want to read this... docs.cpanel.net/cpanel/email/spam-filters/

But, as I mentioned, each email service will probably be different.

Spammers Byte. They make us work too hard, forcing us to read through all the junk anyway, just to see if we missed something important.

Good Luck!!
creator: Chicks_Hate_Me

content: Nope. Doing it as you say, dragging with a left click, places it in the mailing list AND removes it from the main personal address book. I am not holding down any key and am using the left mouse button.
creator: newspr0

content: Are you sure you're dragging from an address book to a mailing list, and not to another address book? The way it normally works, and works on my setup, is that when a contact is added to a mailing list by drag and drop, it's added to the list, but remains in the address book. If a contact is dragged from one address book to another, the contact is moved, i.e. it is removed from the source and added to the target. Holding Ctrl while dragging and dropping will copy the contact, not move it.
creator: sfhowes
